main event: A bright, whitish-colored object was observed over Sharpsville, Pennsylvania for about 20 minutes on September 27, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as square-shaped and appeared to be about 3/4 to 1 mile long.
The object was observed at an altitude of approximately 3,000 feet and was located three-quarters to one mile east of Middleville, Pennsylvania.
The sighting occurred between 3:05 PM and 3:10 PM local time.
The witness was Joseph Hennisko, a Pennsylvania resident and air patrol supervisor since 1956.
Possible thunderstorm activity and lightning were observed in the area at the time of the sighting.
